creator: mightypile@hotmail.com
text:
I've found several people in newsgroups who have had the same error trying to 
compile the openssl code under Visual C++ and WinNT (different flavors from NT 
to XP).  In each case, running "perl Configure VC-WIN32" caused the problem to 
go away.  I thought it would be helpful to add this line to the instructions 
on your page since this is where I started and where I ran into the problem.

Thanks,
   Mike Schmidt
   mightypile@hotmail.com

The openssl instructions do include that line, as the first line you run.  
Unless you need to set up your environment.  Read the install.w32(?) file under 
openssl\; not the Apache site.
creator: towerofpower@operamail.com
rbowen@apache.org
text:
Building openssl is pretty far beyond the scope of the Apache httpd
documentation, but, then, I suppose most of this particular doc is likewise
beyond our stated scope. I've seen remarks a few places to the effect that this
doc is moderately out of date, and needs some significant updates for 2.x, but,
unfortunately, the number of people who can do this update is pretty small.

Your remark that a particular line makes the problems go away is only half
helpful. When, in the order of other commands, should that line be added? An
actual patch to the doc would be the most helpful, but just answering that one
question would be somewhat helpful to getting this problem resolved. Please look
at the latest version of this doc, and let us know if the instructions still
work for you.

Thanks.
